intro: Adenostyles albifrons subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
